programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy finds a way to lighten the mood in the hot California sun, but the bidding wars that ensue are anything but cool.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff, Ton Jones and their feisty new assistant find a pair of high-tech gadgets and a vintage sled at a lively auction in Honolulu.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones put their bidding skills to the test against Hawaiian locals, and discover a vintage motor scooter and some antique Polynesian tattoo tools.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Competition between the top boats heats up as two captains separate themselves from the pack. Meanwhile, the rest grow more and more desperate for paychecks.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The staff of Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue battle to keep the truckers on British Colombia's Coquihalla Highway safe. A heavy rescue attempt and a rock-slide disaster dominate matters.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Motorcycle lover Sharon has not been comfortable on a bike since she lost her leg, so Danny and the crew build a bike for her and her partner that is safe, comfortable and 'cool'.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores a large marquee and repairs a 1948 vending machine that was damaged in a hurricane.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron and Tyler discover a rusty pump that could be worth a fortune if properly restored - but first they need to persuade the owner to part with it.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank head to Minnesota and challenge Danielle to sell a fibreglass cowboy boot they bought more than a year previously.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Grumpy comic Jack Dee, footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker and actress Fay Ripley reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include white-van drivers, competitive parents and people who tell the truth.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Outdoor survival expert Ray Mears, TV presenter Fiona Bruce and comedienne Katherine Ryan tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include caravans, cushions on beds and Cheryl.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the high-brow quiz, serving up a selection of questions on the subject of restaurants. Trying to come up with the answers are Alan Davies, Phill Jupitus, Sara Pascoe and Mark Watson.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The stand-up comedian gets a job as a tattooist's apprentice, but discovers it could be the most painful job of all when he is told he will have to go under the needle himself.

programme.title: Late Nite Eats
programme.desc: Chef Jordan Andino is on the hunt to find restaurants that reign supreme in the late-night food scene, meeting other chefs to taste their most popular dishes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Living With Hitler
programme.desc: Life on the Homefront and abroad is examined: from rationing and bereavement, the Allied bombing campaign, the Holocaust and finally, the fall of the Third Reich.

programme.title: Monster Ships
programme.desc: The MV Helgafell, a reinforced-hulled vessel designed to operate throughout the harsh North Atlantic.

programme.title: Monster Ships
programme.desc: A profile of the Royal Clipper, officially the largest square-rigged ship in the world, which operates as a glamorous high-end cruise ship for sailing enthusiasts.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Sins of the Father - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part story, guest starring Edward Woodward, his son Tim and grandson Sam as three generations of an East End criminal dynasty. Ageing gangster Johnnie Jackson, sensing the onset of Alzheimer's disease, tries to rescue his grandson from a life of crime, but the seeds of destruction are already sown as young Jacko finds himself working for ruthless drug dealer Roger Hutton.

credits.actor: grandson Sam as three generations of an East End criminal dynasty

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The widow of a rich merchant stirs up a tempest of lust as the men of Shrewsbury vie for her hand in marriage - and it seems one has no qualms about murdering all his rivals. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Michael Culver and Julian Firth.

programme.title: FYI Extra

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Women: How Safe Are We? Tonight
programme.desc: The murder of Sarah Everard has opened a wider debate about the safety of women on UK streets, with many sharing their stories for the first time. Could this be a moment for real change? Julie Etchingham reports.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: Let Magic be the soundtrack to your late night listening with some of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let Kiss keep you up all night with the finest collection of RandB tunes and nocturnal beats.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Porsche 993 Targa to renovate, and finds the cheapest one in the country.

programme.title: Richard Hammond's Big
programme.desc: Richard joins the crew of one of the biggest moving objects on earth, the Marie Maersk container ship, on her continuous 28,000-mile voyage from Asia to Europe.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. OCC and PJD rush to finish their Cadillac bikes for the build-off, and Paul Jr faces his father when they unveil their creations at GM.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: Bentley's plans to develop and build a worthy successor to its Continental GT V8, a much-respected coupe that served its manufacturer well.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The work that went into completing the Norwegian Breakaway cruise ship before her maiden voyage across the Atlantic.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in manufacturing rope, billiard tables and sailboards, and how advances in technology have led to improved production methods.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes involved in creating seatbelts, hot-air balloons, windows and wax figurines, and how these methods have adapted to modern technology.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists reconstruct the scene of a bludgeoning in Georgia, USA, in an attempt to track down the suspect in a murder investigation.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.sub-title: Roses Are Red, Murder Is Too
programme.desc: The death of a town council member. Local residents were appalled - especially when the evidence began to suggest a professional 'hit' had taken place.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Detectives try to uncover the identity of a serial killer who they think is responsible for the deaths of a dozen women around St Louis.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigators McHugh and DaBolt discover 50 diseased and deformed animals in the home of a former dog breeder.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A look at the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown and his most embarrassing cases, including a golden retriever that has developed a nasty condition.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A consultant meets 18-year-old bride Kelsey, who arrives with plenty of drama over a broken promise about who would be her maid of honour.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy gets a hole in one with an unusual landscaping tool, and Darrell's eye for upscale furniture finds him a high end hoard.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Goodness, Gracious, Great Coats of Fire
programme.desc: Darrell gets a chance to school his friend in being a daredevil, Dave's fortunes go up in flames, while Jarrod and Brandi dive back in and hit bottom.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy show, with Ed Byrne, Sara Pascoe, Ed Gamble and Nathan Caton joining regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines in September 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games. Chaired by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jimmy Carr and Marcus Brigstocke, TV presenter Terry Christian and singer Jamelia join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Mazda coupe that appears to have nothing wrong with it, so he decides to give expert mechanic Edd China the task of making a good car even better.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How, with no finger prints at the scene, detectives turned to cutting-edge forensic techniques to track a callous killer, hoping to land their man before he could strike again.
